comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: wonderful. This is after the outbreak of the WWI, Aug 1914, as her funnels have already been painted all black, and they were repainted back to her original color again sometime in the fall. In 1915 when she was sunk it is generally believed they were still the original color. You can see she is high in the water, indicating this is the end of the trip as coal and supplies have been used up. This photo is attributed to 1914 based on the visible modifications. You can see the list of them here. titanic-model.com/articles/lusi_tutoria/LUSITANIA_Tutoria... things you can see: the number of life boats, the replaced ventilation caps,and the paint scheme.

comment._content: On the misty morning of March 6, 1914, the Lusitania was greeted in New York Harbor by a throng of baseball fans, as it carried the New York Giants and Chicago White Sox baseball teams home from their five-month world tour. (Bain's photo bears the inscribed date 3/6/14.) Story in The New York Times, March 6, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9805EEDC1E39E6... Another Bain/LOC photo of the baseball men's return: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5169599074/] On March 7, in New York City, tour participants were tendered a sumptuous homecoming banquet: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/boston_public_library/2350719344/] The baseball teams in Egypt: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/uicdigital/4787862018/in/photostream/] And in Japan: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5517543916/in/photostream/] They crossed their bats, and thought of England: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/boston_public_library/2349876523/]

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: that's interesting because the funnels certainly appear to be a single color.  The red  may be harder to distinguish from the black top quarter, but this photo shows no discernible difference on the funnel unlike below and above the waterline. .  War broke out in August, so there should be no reason why it would be solid colored already in March.  It makes you wonder if the photo could have been tampered with in some way or if for some reason lost to history the funnels would have been painted early in the year, or these lighting conditions just make them appear uniform.
